title: Percussion group
creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and ERPI Classroom Films
brief_description: More than a dozen of the more commonly used percussion instruments are demonstrated. Chief attention is given to the structure, manner of tuning and playing of the tympani. Other percussion instruments represented are the tom-tom, snare drum, bass drum, tambourine, gong cymbals, castanets, triangle bells, celeste, chimes and the xylophone. Included into the compositions used are portions of Schubert’s “March Militaire” and of Tchaikovsky’s “Fourth Symphony”. Demonstrations throughout are given in full orchestral setting.
